Headline: Breakingviews - Cox: Aramco and Amazon encourage bad behavior

Amazon sells stuff online  ships it to customers rapidly and reinvests the profits to destroy the economics of every industry it enters.

Headline: Column: Jeff Bezos has two words for you: â€˜No comment.'

Article: By Ernest Scheyder     July 25 International Paper Co  the largest provider of shipping boxes for Amazon.com Inc  and other giant e-commerce companies  posted a better-than-expected quarterly profit on Thursday  helped by price hikes in its biggest unit.     IP  which makes shipping boxes as well as boxes for consumer goods such as medicines and cigarettes  said it expected results would only improve later this year as it becomes more efficient and takes market share. Headline: International Paper profit nearly doubles on price hikes
Article: International Paper Co   the largest provider of shipping boxes for Amazon.com Inc  and other giant e-commerce companies  said Thursday that quarterly net income nearly doubled as it raised prices in its largest unit.

Headline: Penguin promises EU regulator to scrap Apple ebook deals
Article: BRUSSELS EU regulators accepted on Thursday a pledge by British media group Pearson's Penguin unit to scrap its ebook deals with Apple which set price curbs on Amazon and other retailers  closing an antitrust case against the company.

Article: BRUSSELS  July 25 EU regulators accepted on Thursday a pledge by British media group Pearson's  Penguin unit to scrap its e-book deals with Apple which set price curbs on Amazon and other retailers  closing an antitrust case against the company.

Headline: Patent company Eolas loses patents to web sites after appeal
Article: WASHINGTON A U.S. appeals court on Monday ruled in favor of Google  Amazon and J.C. Penney by upholding an earlier court decision that major portions of two patents claimed by Eolas Technologies Inc were invalid.

Headline: Amazon vs IBM: Big Blue meets match in battle for the cloud
Article: SAN FRANCISCO  July 21 The tech industry maxim that "no one ever got fired for buying IBM" is a testament to how Big Blue has been the gold standard in computing services for decades.

Headline: Amazon criticized over low German tax bill
Article: LONDON Amazon.com Inc's main German unit paid income tax of just 3 million euros in 2012 after the group channeled sales to German clients of $8.7 billion via Luxembourg units  prompting one lawmaker to call for an investigation of the company.

Headline: Amazon criticised over low German tax bill
Article: LONDON  July 12 Amazon.com Inc's main German unit paid income tax of just 3 million euros in 2012 after the group channelled sales to German clients of $8.7 billion via Luxembourg units  prompting one lawmaker to call for an investigation of the company.

Headline: RadioShack says its balance sheet is strong  shares up
Article: RadioShack Corp  said on Friday that its balance sheet continues to be strong  with total liquidity of $820 million at the end of the first quarter  a day after a trade publication reported that the electronics retailer was considering hiring a financial adviser.

Headline: EU court backs Austria in Amazon row over levies
Article: VIENNA EU countries can under some circumstances collect a levy on blank recording media as a tool to ensure artists get fair rewards for their work  a levy that Amazon.com Inc had fought  the European Court of Justice ruled on Thursday.

Headline: Barnes & Noble CEO resigns after Nook sales slump

Headline: UPDATE 2-Barnes & Noble CEO resigns after Nook sales slump
Article: NEW YORK  July 8 Barnes & Noble Inc  Chief Executive William Lynch resigned on Monday after he led a failed attempt by the U.S. bookstore chain to compete against the likes of Amazon.com Inc  Apple Inc and Google Inc in the e-reader and tablet markets.

Headline: Brazil data indicate increase in Amazon deforestation
Article: RIO DE JANEIRO Brazilian government figures released on Friday indicated further rise in deforestation in the Amazon  a trend that could soon amount to a full year's reversal from recent progress in the battle against destruction of the world's largest rainforest.

Headline: Governments to target tech giants' tax avoidance: draft
Article: BERLIN/LONDON Western governments are set to target a range of tax loopholes used by technology giants including Apple  Amazon as part of an international drive to tackle corporate tax avoidance  a draft action plan seen by Reuters said.

Article: BERLIN/LONDON  July 5 Western governments are set to target a range of tax loopholes used by technology giants including Apple  Amazon as part of an international drive to tackle corporate tax avoidance  a draft action plan seen by Reuters said.

Headline: Catholic nun's Brazilian killer gets early release from prison
Article: SAO PAULO The man convicted of killing American nun and Amazon activist Dorothy Stang in 2005  has been released from a Brazilian prison after serving less than a third of his sentence  adding controversy to the long-running struggle over land rights in the rainforest.

Headline: UPDATE 1-Vale obtains license to expand giant Amazon iron ore mine

Headline: Publisher scraps Paula Deen's top-selling cookbook before release
Article: LOS ANGELES An upcoming book of recipes by disgraced celebrity chef Paula Deen that shot to the top of online bookseller Amazon's best-sellers list has been canceled  the publisher said on Friday  adding to the fallout from Deen's use of a racial slur.

Article: SAN FRANCISCO  June 27 Since 2010  Square Inc's matchbox-sized card readers have steadily supplanted credit card machines in coffee shops and corner stores across the United States.

Headline: France to seek ban on Amazon bundled discounts  free delivery
Article: PARIS France's Socialist government aims to introduce a law preventing online retailer Amazon from offering both discounts and free delivery for books in France  the culture minister said  arguing this amounts to unfair competition.

Headline: Apple warns of "chilling effect" as antitrust trial ends
Article: NEW YORK Apple Inc  on trial for allegedly colluding to raise the price of e-books  said on Thursday an adverse ruling would have a "chilling effect" on how businesses investigate new markets.

Headline: Rocket's Lazada gets $100 million in bid to be Southeast Asia's Amazon

Article: June 20 Lazada  the Southeast Asian online retail company founded by Germany's Rocket Internet Gmbh  has secured another $100 million from investors in its bid to lift the region from its status as an e-commerce backwater.

Headline: From the ashes of Webvan  Amazon builds a grocery business
Article: SAN FRANCISCO The online grocery start-up Webvan may have been the single most expensive flame-out of the dot-com era  blowing through more than $800 million in venture capital and IPO proceeds in just over three years before shutting its doors in 2001.
